nodes.text: Gruuvan Shaal Kebabs were a type of traditional Twi'lek kebab made from meats and vegetables. They were consumable by Twi'leks and Artiodacs and were considered savory. For some time, Gruuvan Shaal Kebabs were banned from Takodana Castle on the planet Takodana because of the kebab sticks' usability as a weapon. However, Maz Kanata, owner of the castle, eventually decided to allow her chef, Strono Tuggs, to serve them once again. Once he was so permitted, he brought out his skewers and began grilling them once more.

At some point after the Battle of Takodana in 34 ABY, Tuggs published a recipe for the kebabs in his cookbook The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook. In the book, he noted that they were a classic Twi'lek dish and shared the story of their temporary ban at Takodana Castle.

Gruuvan Shaal Kebabs were first mentioned in the 2019 recipe book Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, which was authored by Chelsea Monroe-Cassel and Marc Sumerak. The out-of-universe recipe for the dish calls for red curry paste, soy sauce, garam masala, garlic, the juice of a lime, salt, pepper, alligator meat or chicken meat, a green bell pepper, and a red onion.

Gruuvan shaal was originally introduced to the Star Wars Legends continuity in the 1998 campaign guide The Far Orbit Project, written by Timothy S. O'Brien and published by West End Games for use with Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game. It then made a full appearance in the 2003 video game Star Wars Galaxies.
